channel.title: Unable to login into runescape delta source
channel.description:
i dled deltasource and heavily modified it with brand new home, and added more than 100 monsters and things to do for people....well when i put it up for people to play, people can get on except me O_o
the client comes up with this error. keep in mind im still trying to learn
Connection from **************** [client-1-Trivenge]: Not from localhost! ClientHandler: Client null disconnected (********) Connection from **************** [client-1-Trivenge]: Not from localhost! ClientHandler: Client null disconnected (*********) Connection from ************** [client-1-Trivenge]: Not from localhost! ClientHandler: Client null disconnected (***********)
the stars representt he ip address in which i am connecting from...i checked the files and i couldnt find anything but i began to wonder if syipkpker protection in the files is causing it to limit 1 copnnection per ip....any help would be greatly apprecieated

item.title: Unable to login into runescape delta source
item.dc:creator: @God11 God11
item.description:
@God11 wrote:

the reason it is doing that is because you must have changed this code

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("delta") && !connectedFrom.equals("127.0.0.1") && !connectedFrom.startsWith("adsl-99")){ println("Not from localhost!"); returnCode = 9; disconnected = true; savefile = false; return; }

i change the name to mine and it did the same so i just left it other wise go back change it back to delta and it should work or you can change it to your internet i guess maybe that’d work to

Read full topic

@trivenge wrote:

yea it is[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 08, 2008, 01:33:30 am[/size][hr][quote=“Compact, post:8, topic:235622”]Is your server currently running?[/quote]
do yyou want me to send you ip address to test if it works? i just wanna know that people can get on…if thats true then at least i would know that something is limiting me but im not quite sure.

item.title: Unable to login into runescape delta source
item.dc:creator: @trivenge trivenge
item.description:
@trivenge wrote:

[quote=“Compact, post:4, topic:235622”]Have you tried connecting with-out localhost.
And use your server’s ip address.[/quote]
i put the ip address within the client, i would state it here but it is against the rules. i changed it in the egui java file, after that i went through client.java and fixed the port to default and portforwarded using utorrent. i used the ip i was given at no-ip…any ideas if i put them in the wrong folder etc?

Read full topic
